text: I worked for a long time
with a start-up and we were always very
keen to rapidly prototype any of the
ideas that came from from our founders
heads we really liked the idea of just
by taking an idea taking an a hour
period just building something and
seeing you know does this work I really
liked the statement that was in one of
the one of the challenges about the loss
of 4% of revenue due to stock not being
on a on a shelf I saw that stain when I
was like how can we use some AWS
technologies to drive a product which
can kind of call back some of that what
we really want to test was you know can
we use computer vision to determine how
for the shelf was and then can we
incorporate additional sensors to make
that more accurate so can we determine
how many items are in terms of depth of
the shelf can we make it work offline as
well as online so we used recognition to
take a picture of the shelf and
determine what was going on we use the
text detection technology specifically
we looked at a back port that we put on
the back of the shelf to say you know
which letters can you see these letters
were in specific positions and based on
the the coordinates given to us by
recognition we could determine which
letters were visible where they were in
relation to one another and as such how
how the Shelf firm was populated we also
used api gateway and lambda to store and
process those results so that we could
display them to a user so a degree
attorneys really helped us to move
really quickly we didn't need to build
image recognition ourselves we didn't
need any service to set up instead what
we did is we focused on on using the
existing technologies and finding a way
to kind of exploit the features of them
to really get as much business value for
our customers possible
[Music]
